DataElement.preferredName: Patient Receive Prior High Dose Corticosteroid And Immunotherapeutic Agent Prior Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine study eligibility as to whether the patient has received prior high doses of corticosteroids and immunomodulatory drugs, as outlined in the protocol, prior to registration.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Receive Prior High Dose Corticosteroid And Immunotherapeutic Agent Prior Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._To take, accept, or get something offered._Earlier in time or order._An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation)._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Any substance that induces, enhances, restores or suppresses the host's immune system, or an agent that utilizes or is derived from a component of the immune system._Earlier in time or order._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Receive Prior High Dose Corticosteroid And Immunotherapeutic Agent Prior Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: To take, accept, or get something offered.:Earlier in time or order.:An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Any substance that induces, enhances, restores or suppresses the host's immune system, or an agent that utilizes or is derived from a component of the immune system.:Earlier in time or order.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.
An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Any substance that induces, enhances, restores or suppresses the host's immune system, or an agent that utilizes or is derived from a component of the immune system.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received prior hi
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior high dose corticosteroids and immunomodulatory drugs (thalidomide or lenalidomide) less than or equal to 7 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive a stable dose of corticosteroids for 2 weeks prior to enrollment?
